text:
Andale is a city in Sedgwick County, Kansas, United States. In 2010, 928 people lived there.
History.
Andale was created in the early 1880s. The city's name is a portmanteau of the last names of two families of early settlers, the Andersons and Dales.
Andale was a station and shipping point on the Missouri Pacific Railroad.
Geography.
Andale is at (37.791221, -97.629156). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of. All of it is land.
People.
Andale is part of the Wichita, KS Metropolitan Statistical Area.
2010 census.
The 2010 census says that there were 928 people, 290 households, and 236 families living in Andale.
Education.
Andale is part of the Renwick USD 267 public school district. Andale has one high school and one elementary school. Andale High School's mascot is the Andale Indians. The school colors are black and gold.
